title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
description:
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II

You are given an integer array prices where prices[i] is the price of a given stock on the ith day.

On each day, you may decide to buy and/or sell the stock. However, you can buy it then immediately sell it on the same day. Also, you are allowed to perform any number of transactions but can hold at most one share of the stock at any time.

Find and return the maximum profit you can achieve.

Examples

  • Input: prices = [7,1,5,3,6,4]
    Output: 7
    Explanation: Buy on day 2 (price = 1) and sell on day 3 (price = 5), profit = 5-1 = 4. Then buy on day 4 (price = 3) and sell on day 5 (price = 6), profit = 6-3 = 3. Total profit is 4 + 3 = 7.
  • Input: prices = [1,2,3,4,5]
    Output: 4
    Explanation: Buy on day 1 (price = 1) and sell on day 5 (price = 5), profit = 5-1 = 4. Total profit is 4.

Constraints

  • 1 <= prices.length <= 30,000
  • 0 <= prices[i] <= 10,000
solution_text:
Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II

Algorithm:

  1. Iterate through consecutive price pairs
  2. Add profit for every positive price difference
  3. This captures all upward price movements
  4. Equivalent to buying before increase, selling before decrease

Time Complexity: O(n) - single pass through prices

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant extra space

Key Insights:

  • Greedy approach: capture every profitable opportunity
  • Can buy and sell on same day if profitable
  • Sum of all positive differences gives maximum profit
verify:
def verify(actual_output, expected_output):
    passed = actual_output == expected_output
    output_str = str(actual_output)
    return [passed, output_str]
